meanings.definition: The act of refusing or rejecting something.
meanings.sent1: She always gives turndowns to invitations to parties.
meanings.sent2: The company received many turndowns for their job offers.
meanings.sent3: His turndowns of dessert were met with disappointment by his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her turndowns of his advances were clear and final.
meanings.sent5: The turndowns of his proposals became a pattern in their relationship.

meanings.definition: A decrease in volume or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The turndowns of the music made it hard to hear the lyrics.
meanings.sent2: The turndowns of the lights signaled the end of the show.
meanings.sent3: The turndowns of the noise level in the library were appreciated by the students.
meanings.sent4: The turndowns of the party atmosphere brought a sense of calm.
meanings.sent5: The turndowns of the storm's intensity brought relief to the residents.

meanings.sent1: The road had turndowns that made driving challenging.
meanings.sent2: The turndowns of the hill made it perfect for sledding.
meanings.sent3: The turndowns of the ski slope were thrilling for the experienced skiers.
meanings.sent4: The turndowns of the roof helped with rainwater drainage.
meanings.sent5: The turndowns of the landscape created a beautiful view from the top.
